</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis 
(&#8220;MD&amp;A&#8221;) prepared as of <font style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: 
transparent; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font 
style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">August 6</font>,</font> 2013 reviews the financial 
condition and results of operations of Great Panther Silver Limited 
(&#8220;Great Panther&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) for the three and six
month financial periods ended June 30, 2013, and other material events up to the
date of this report.&#160;&#160;The information in this MD&amp;A is as at <font 
style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">August 6</font>, 2013 unless otherwise 
indicated.&#160;&#160;The following discussion should be read in conjunction 
with the annual audited consolidated financial statements and related notes for 
the year ended December 31, 2012 and the unaudited condensed interim 
consolidated financial statements and related notes for the three and six month 
periods ended June 30, 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The financial data included in the discussion provided in this 
report has been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting 
Standards (&#8220;IFRS&#8221;) as issued by the International Accounting 
Standards Board.&#160;&#160;All dollar amounts are in Canadian dollars, unless 
otherwise noted.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This MD&amp;A contains forward-looking statements and should be
read in conjunction with the risk factors described in the &#8220;Risks and 
Uncertainties&#8221; and &#8220;Cautionary Statement on Forward-Looking 
Statements&#8221; sections at the end of this MD&amp;A, as well as 
&#8220;Description of the Business &#8211; Risk Factors&#8221; in the 
Company&#8217;s Annual Information Form (&#8220;AIF&#8221;) for the year ended 
December 31, 2012.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This MD&amp;A also makes reference to Cash Cost per Ounce, 
EBITDA, and Adjusted EBITDA.&#160;&#160;These are considered Non-IFRS 
Measures.&#160;&#160;Please refer to the &#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221; section
of this MD&amp;A for an explanation of these measures and a reconciliation to 
the Company&#8217;s reported financial results.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">PROFILE AND STRATEGY</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Great Panther Silver Limited is a primary silver mining and 
exploration company listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange trading under the 
symbol GPR, and on the NYSE MKT trading under the symbol GPL.&#160;&#160;The 
Company&#8217;s current activities are focused on the mining of precious metals 
from its two wholly-owned operating mines in Mexico, Topia and 
Guanajuato.&#160;&#160;Great Panther is in the process of developing its San 
Ignacio project with a view to production in 2014 and has two exploration 
projects, El Horcon and Santa Rosa, all of which are also located in 
Mexico.&#160;&#160;The Company is also pursuing additional mining opportunities 
within Latin America, with the goal of adding to its portfolio of mineral 
properties.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All of Great Panther&#8217;s assets in Mexico are held through 
Minera Mexicana el Rosario, S.A. de C.V. (&#8220;MMR&#8221;), a wholly-owned 
subsidiary acquired in February 2004.&#160;&#160;In 2005, the Company 
incorporated Metalicos de Durango, S.A. de C.V. (&#8220;MDU&#8221;) and Minera 
de Villa Seca, S.A. de C.V (&#8220;MVS&#8221;).&#160;&#160;These two operating 
subsidiaries of the Company are responsible for the day-to-day affairs and 
operations of the Topia and Guanajuato Mines, respectively, through service 
agreements with MMR.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s Topia Mine is located in the Sierra Madre 
Mountains in the state of Durango in northwestern Mexico and produces silver, 
gold, lead and zinc.&#160;&#160;The Guanajuato Mine Complex is located in the 
city of Guanajuato, in central Mexico, approximately 380 kilometres north-west 
of Mexico City, and produces silver and gold.&#160;&#160;Each mine has its own 
processing facility with capacity to support future expansion.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Great Panther&#8217;s development stage property, the San 
Ignacio Project, is approximately 20 kilometres by road from its Cata processing
plant in Guanajuato.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s Santa Rosa Project is 
located approximately 15 kilometres northeast of Guanajuato, and the El Horcon 
Project is located 60 kilometres northwest of Guanajuato.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">SIGNIFICANT TRANSACTIONS AND EVENTS 
AFFECTING OPERATIONS</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The second quarter of 2013 saw significant declines in silver 
and gold prices and Great Panther continued to seek ways to reduce costs and 
improve grades at its wholly-owned Mexican properties.&#160;&#160;Important 
developments in the Company&#8217;s business since the start of the second 
quarter are as follows.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 14, 2013, the Company announced the appointment of Mr. 
Geoff Chater to its Board of Directors. The Company also announced the addition 
of two senior personnel to the management team in Guanajuato, Mexico, Mr. Juan 
Manuel Flores, Vice President, Operations and Mr. Cesar Epifanio, Vice 
President, Safety, Health and Environment.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 30, 2013, the Company announced that Mr. Robert Archer, 
co-founder and CEO of the Company, had resumed the role of President and CEO 
upon the resignation of Mr. Martin Carsky, President.&#160;&#160;A severance 
payment totalling $0.7 million was made to Mr. Carsky upon his resignation, in 
full settlement of the Company&#8217;s obligations to Mr. Carsky under his 
employment contract.&#160;&#160;The payment represents a portion of the 
Company&#8217;s obligation to Mr. Carsky under a termination without 
cause.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Throughout the second quarter of 2013, initiatives to improve 
grade control and reduce costs at the Company&#8217;s two operating mines, 
Guanajuato and Topia, were implemented in response to the low grades yielded in 
the first quarter of 2013.&#160; The sharp drop in precious metal prices early 
in the second quarter provided further impetus for these 
initiatives.&#160;&#160;As a result of these efforts, the Company saw improved 
grades and lower unit operating costs at both of its mines in May and 
June.&#160;&#160;However, the impact of improved grades was not reflected in 
margins or unit costs for the current quarter as most sales reflected production
from April and the prior quarter at lower grades.&#160;&#160;Management expects 
that the third quarter results will reflect the benefit from the sale of the 
lower cost, higher grade production from the second quarter.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In the second quarter, the Company reduced the number of mining
contractors at Guanajuato and renegotiated the contract arrangements to better 
align the remaining contractors with the objectives of reducing costs and 
increasing efficiencies and productivity.&#160;&#160;The Company has re-focussed
most of its exploration resources on its existing operations and greater 
emphasis is being placed on grade control and improving planning and 
coordination within the operations teams.&#160;&#160;The Company will continue 
to look for ways to further improve grades and reduce site costs and 
overheads.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Plans for the development and ramp-up of production at San 
Ignacio remain on track and in-fill drilling is planned for the fourth 
quarter.&#160;&#160;The drill program at El Horcon was completed in the second 
quarter and an internal resource estimation and preliminary economic assessment 
is being completed.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
<hr>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EGDAG">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">1</font></font><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt; COLOR: 
black">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Adjusted EBITDA&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure in which 
standard EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization)
is adjusted for share-based payments expense, foreign exchange gains or losses, 
and non-recurring items.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221;
section for the definition and a reconciliation of standardized and adjusted 
EBITDA to the financial statements.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt"><a name="ref.ID0ETRAG">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">2</font></font><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt; COLOR: 
black">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver equivalent ounces in 2013 were established using prices 
of US$28 per oz, US$1,680 per oz, US$0.85 per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for silver,
gold, lead and zinc, respectively, and applied to the recovered metal content of
the concentrates that were produced by the two operations. For consistency, 
these prices will be used for the balance of 2013.</font></div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt"><a name="ref.ID0EKZAG">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">3</font></font><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt; COLOR: 
black">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Cash cost per silver ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure 
and is used by the Company to manage and evaluate operating performance at each 
of the Company&#8217;s mines and is widely reported in the silver mining 
industry as a benchmark for performance, but does not have a standardized 
meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221; 
section.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EX4AG">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">4</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Average 
realized silver price is prior to treatment, refining and smelting 
charges.</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">

FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5</font></div>

<div id="HDR">

</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Second Quarter 2013 Operational 
Highlights</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-

<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" face="Symbol, 
serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metal production increased 12% from the first quarter of 2013 
to a record 680,212 Ag eq oz and increased 22% from the second quarter of 
2012;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-

<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">

</td>
<td>

align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver production of 396,730 ounces increased 7% from the first
quarter of 2013, and increased 6% from the second quarter of 2012;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-

<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" face="Symbol, 
serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>

align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gold production reached a record 3,994 ounces, an increase of 
27% over the first quarter of 2013 and 70% over the second quarter of 
2012;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>

quarter of 2012 and&#160;decreased by 3% over the first quarter of 
2013;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>

first quarter of 2013 and a 59% increase over the second quarter of 
2012;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

silver and gold grades showed improvements against the first quarter of 2013 
reflective of the efforts in this area;</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mined and processed ore for the consolidated operations for the
second quarter of 2013 was 67,569 tonnes.&#160;&#160;This represents an increase
of 28% compared to the same quarter in 2012 and a decrease of 3% compared to the
previous quarter.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EAIAI">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">1</font></font>&#160;&#160;&#160;Silver equivalent 
ounces in 2013 were established using prices of US$28 per oz, US$1,680 per oz, 
US$0.85 per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for silver, gold, lead and zinc, 
respectively, and applied to the recovered metal content of the concentrates 
that were produced by the two operations. For consistency, these prices will be 
used for the balance of 2013.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EWQAI">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font></font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#8220;Cash cost per 
ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure and is used by the Company to manage and 
evaluate operating performance at each of the Company&#8217;s mines and is 
widely reported in the silver mining industry as a benchmark for performance, 
but does not have a standardized meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Non-
IFRS Measures&#8221; section.</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">6</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Overall metal production for the second quarter of 2013 was a 
record 680,212 Ag eq oz, an increase of 22% compared to the second quarter in 
2012, and was mainly due to higher throughput at both operations and increased 
gold production at Guanajuato.&#160;&#160;Metal production on an Ag eq oz basis 
increased 12% from the production of the previous quarter, due to higher silver 
and gold grades at Guanajuato and higher silver grades at Topia.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Consolidated cash cost per silver ounce was US$18.14 for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013, a 59% increase compared to US$11.42 for the 
same period in 2012, and a 2% decrease compared to US$18.60 in the previous
quarter.&#160;&#160;The increase in the consolidated cash cost per silver ounce 
over the second quarter of 2012 was due to lower silver grades at both 
Guanajuato and Topia together with high site costs at both mine 
sites.&#160;&#160;The decrease over the previous quarter is attributed to 
improved grades and to increased gold production at Guanajuato which increased 
by-product credits despite the decline in gold prices.</font><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><img 
src="gpr7.jpg" alt="Graphic"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Guanajuato Mine Complex</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Guanajuato processed 52,917 tonnes in the second quarter of 
2013, an increase of 29% from the second quarter of 2012 and an increase of 1% 
from the previous quarter.&#160;&#160;The increase reflects the processing of 
approximately 7,000 tonnes of mineral dumps purchased from a third 
party.&#160;&#160;The Company expects to process a further 1,500 tonnes of 
mineral dumps from this third party in the third quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metal production was a record 466,925 Ag eq oz for the second 
quarter of 2013, representing an increase of 30% from the second quarter of 2012
and an increase of 17% from the previous quarter.&#160;&#160;Higher silver and 
gold grades together with an increase in throughput explain the increase in 
metal production quarter over quarter.&#160;&#160;The increase over the prior 
year is mainly due to an increase in throughput, and significantly higher gold 
grades.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver production, at 236,454 ounces, was up 4% from the second
quarter of 2012 due to an increase in throughput of 29% which offset lower 
silver grades.&#160;&#160;Silver production was up 6% from the first quarter of 
2013 due mainly to higher grades.&#160;&#160;Guanajuato&#8217;s gold production 
continued to increase and reached a record of 3,841 ounces in the second quarter
of 2013.&#160;&#160;This is reflective of increased production from the gold-
rich Santa Margarita zone.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">7</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The average silver grade in the second quarter of 2013 was 
159g/t compared to 189g/t and 148g/t in the second quarter of 2012 and the first
quarter of 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;Gold grades for the second quarter of 
2013 of 2.47g/t compared to 1.82g/t and 1.93g/t in the second quarter of 2012 
and the previous quarter, respectively.&#160;&#160;Silver grades improved during
the second quarter at Cata, Los Pozos and Guanajuatito compared with the first 
quarter of 2013 and gold grades at Santa Margarita averaged around 
4.00g/t.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Plant metallurgical performance remained strong, with metal 
recoveries of 87.2% for silver and 91.5% for gold.&#160;&#160;Although 
recoveries remained strong, silver recoveries decreased slightly over the prior 
quarter due to the processing of approximately 7,000 tonnes of mineral dump 
material purchased from a third party.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<td align="right" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2.47</font></div>
</td>

</td>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><img src="gpr8.jpg" alt="Graphic"></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EAIAI">&#160;</a><a name="ref.ID0ENPBI">&#160;</a></div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">1</font></font>&#160;&#160;&#160;Silver equivalent 
ounces in 2013 were established using prices of US$28 per oz, US$1,680 per oz, 
US$0.85 per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for silver, gold, lead and zinc, 
respectively, and applied to the recovered metal content of the concentrates 
that were produced by the two operations.&#160;&#160;For consistency, these 
prices will be used for the balance of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">&#160;</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">8</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The majority of metal production for the three months ended 
June 30, 2013 was from the lower levels of Cata and Santa Margarita which 
continued to excel in terms of grades.&#160;&#160;Mining at Cata demonstrated 
that the hanging wall veins which merge with the main Veta Madre at the 510 
metre level resulted in well mineralized ore.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Since the third quarter of 2012, the Rayas Shaft has been shut 
down for a renovation program to enhance the overall safety conditions and 
increase efficiency in terms of the ability and capacity to transport 
personnel.&#160;&#160;The rehabilitation is expected to complete during the 
third quarter of 2013 and is expected to improve the transportation of personnel
to their work places and increase operational efficiencies by reducing 
transportation times.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Cata processing plant is being upgraded with the 
installation of a new filter press that will maximize the rate of filtration, 
deliver a dryer final concentrate, and reduce concentrate loss and electricity 
consumption.&#160;&#160;The installation is expected to be complete in 
August.&#160;&#160;During July 2013, the Guanajuato tailings dam went through 
its thirteenth dyke lift to increase its storage.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The development of the Guanajuatito main ramp was temporarily 
suspended to put in place the development required to support an exploration 
drilling program to upgrade the mineral resources between the 245 and 390 metre 
levels. This program will commence during the third quarter. The Guanajuatito 
Mine was connected underground to all the other mines in the Guanajuato Mine 
Complex.&#160;&#160;As a result, Guanajuatito ore production, which was 
previously hauled to surface via the ramp and then by truck to the Cata plant, 
is now able to be transported underground and up the Cata shaft, thereby 
reducing haulage costs.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Santa Margarita main ramp reached the 510 metre level, from
which an exploration crosscut is being developed, aiming to further define the 
ore structure's potential as indicated by exploration drilling. In addition, 
exploratory development was completed at the 490 metre level to define the Santa
Margarita vein and assist the mining activities. Overall gold grades at 
Guanajuato have increased significantly, with the most meaningful contribution 
coming from Santa Margarita.&#160;&#160;However, the increase was largely due to
the gradual elimination of production from the low grade San Vicente 
Zone.&#160;&#160;Silver grades recently started to show notable improvements 
across all zones due to better grade control.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Guanajuato Mine Complex Cash Cost per Silver
Ounce</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>

</div>
<div><br>
<hr>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0E1KDI"><!--EFPlaceholder--></a>&#160;</div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">1</font></font>&#160;Gross by-product revenue is 
defined as revenue from the by-products of silver, specifically gold at 
Guanajuato and gold, lead and zinc at Topia, net of the respective smelting and 
refining charges.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EDAAK">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font></font>&#160;&#8220;Cash cost per silver
ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure and is used by the Company to manage and 
evaluate operating performance at each of the Company&#8217;s mines and is 
widely reported in the silver mining industry as a benchmark for performance, 
but does not have a standardized meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Non-
IFRS Measures&#8221; section.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">9</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash cost per silver ounce at Guanajuato for the second quarter
of 2013 was US$17.26, compared to US$7.75 in the second quarter of 2012 and 
US$17.29 in the first quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;The increase over the second 
quarter of 2012 was primarily due to lower silver grades and increased site 
costs. Compared to the first quarter of 2013, silver and gold grades improved 
and unit production costs decreased as a result of the higher 
grades.&#160;&#160;Unfortunately, these improvements did not translate into 
meaningfully lower cash cost per ounce as most of the May and June production at
higher grades and lower unit costs remained in inventory at the end of the 
quarter due to shipping lead times.&#160;&#160;It is expected that the third 
quarter results will reflect the benefit from the sale of the lower cost, higher
grade production from the second quarter.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Topia Mine</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Mill throughput for Topia for the second quarter of 2013 was 
14,652 tonnes of ore, representing a 22% increase over the second quarter of the
prior year. The second quarter of 2012 reflected reduced processing at Topia due
to drought conditions at the time which caused water shortages and limited the 
Company&#8217;s ability to process ore. Mill throughput in the second quarter of
2013 decreased 14% over the previous quarter and this reflected the 
Company&#8217;s initiatives to improve grades.&#160;&#160;As a result of these 
efforts, silver grades improved over the first quarter of 2013 and metal 
production increased despite the decrease in throughput.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Metal production at Topia for the second quarter of 2013 was 
213,287 Ag eq oz comprising 160,276 Ag oz, 153 Au oz, 243 Pb tonnes, and 411 Zn 
tonnes.&#160;&#160;Production on an equivalent ounce basis was up 8% and 3% 
compared to the second quarter of 2012 and the first quarter of 2013, 
respectively.&#160;&#160;The increase from the second quarter of 2012 is due to 
increased throughput of 22% which offset a decrease in average ore grades of 
silver, lead and zinc between the periods.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Topia Mine Production Data</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>

new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<td align="left" valign="top" width="22%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Tonnes milled</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="10%">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">14,652</font></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EZEBK">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> Silver equivalent ounces in 2013 were established using 
prices US$28 per oz, US$1,680 per oz, US$0.85 per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for 
silver, gold, lead and zinc, respectively, and applied to the recovered metal 
content of the concentrates that were produced by the two operations. For 
consistency, these prices will be used for the balance of 2013.</font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">10</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><img 
src="gpr11.jpg" alt="Graphic"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The average grades of ore processed from Topia in the second 
quarter of 2013 were 376g/t Ag, 0.57g/t Au, 1.79% Pb and 3.05% 
Zn.&#160;&#160;Silver grades were lower compared to 424g/t in the second quarter
of 2012, but were significantly improved compared to 300g/t in the first quarter
of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The majority of the metal production during the quarter was 
obtained from the 1522 and Durangue&#241;o mines, followed closely by the 
Argentina and El Rosario mines, which showed increased production due to the 
continuous narrow vein formations resulting in higher 
dilution.&#160;&#160;However, silver grades improved compared to the 300g/t 
realized in the first quarter of 2013 due to ongoing efforts to improve grade 
control.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Plant metallurgical performance was satisfactory in the second 
quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;Recoveries were 90.6% for Ag, 57.0% for Au, 92.5% 
for Pb and 91.9% for Zn.&#160;&#160;In the current quarter, improvements are 
being made to the Topia processing plant, which include the installation of a 
cone crusher that will significantly increase the crushing capacity at the 
plant, and reduce maintenance and electricity costs.&#160;&#160;In addition, a 
performance improvement analysis is being undertaken to seek ways to further 
optimize the mill and flotation sections of the plant.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the second quarter, underground development at Topia 
consisted of 2,254 metres, down 14% compared to the same period in 
2012.&#160;&#160;The development program for the quarter was focused on 
deepening main ramps at the Argentina and La Prieta mines to access new 
mineralized levels indicated by exploration drilling results.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Development was carried out to prepare sublevels, raises and 
stopes for production. Development reached level 4 as planned at the Argentina 
main ramp, whereas development of the La Prieta ramp was temporarily suspended 
giving priority to preparatory work for production.&#160;&#160;In addition, the
2013 surface drilling program has been deferred as part of the Company&#8217;s 
overall cost reduction plans.&#160;&#160;Exploration of the Durangue&#241;o area
will now be partially completed from the underground drilling 
stations.&#160;&#160;Finally, deep drilling of the Argentina vein is being 
deferred until 2014.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>

FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">11</font></div>

<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">

FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Topia Mine Cash Cost per Silver Ounce</font></div>

ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">22.23</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; 
TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px 
double; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>

SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">$</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-

<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double;

</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash cost per silver ounce for Topia for the second quarter of 
2013 increased by 8% to US$19.67 from US$18.26 in the same period in the prior 
year, and decreased by 4% when compared to US$20.52 in the prior 
quarter.&#160;&#160;The increase over the second quarter of 2012 is mainly due 
to higher site costs and lower grades.&#160;&#160;The decrease over the first 
quarter of 2013 is primarily due to improvements in silver grade and 
recoveries.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">RESOURCE AND EXPLORATION UPDATE</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Guanajuato Mine Complex</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A total of 6,426 metres (36 holes) of underground drilling was 
completed in the second quarter of 2013 at the Cata Deep, Pozos, Santa 
Margarita, and Valenciana zones which was up 3% compared to the prior 
year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exploration drilling is continuing at Cata Clavo, Santa 
Margarita, Rayas Deep, and Guanajuatito.&#160;&#160;The programs are configured 
to explore down-dip extensions of the mineralized zones at 25- to 50-metre 
spacing.&#160;&#160;For the remainder of 2013, the Company plans approximately 
9,500 metres of exploration drilling at the Guanajuato Mine 
Complex.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s latest mineral resource estimate for
Guanajuato was released in May 2012 (refer to the corresponding technical 
reports dated June 26, 2012 filed on SEDAR on June 28, 2012).&#160;&#160;The 
mineral resource estimate is valid as of January 31, 2012:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0ERNEK">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> Gross by-product revenue is defined as revenue from the by-
products of silver, specifically gold at Guanajuato and gold, lead and zinc at 
Topia, net of the respective smelting and refining charges.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0ELHFK">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font></font>&#160;&#8220;Cash cost per silver 
ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure and is used by the Company to manage and 
evaluate operating performance at each of the Company&#8217;s mines and is 
widely reported in the silver mining industry as a benchmark for performance, 
but does not have a standardized meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Non-
IFRS Measures&#8221; section.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EBIFK">&#160; </a></div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

Mine</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s latest mineral resource estimate for Topia 
was released in January 2013 (refer to the corresponding technical reports dated
February 27, 2013 filed on SEDAR on February 26, 2013).&#160;&#160;The mineral 
resource estimate is valid as of June 30, 2012:</font></div>

<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">9,540,000</font></div>
</td>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The updated estimate represents a decrease over the resource 
reported in 2011 (see news release March 7, 2011), however a direct comparison 
of the present and past mineral resources is not accurate due to differing metal
prices and minimum Net Smelter Return (&#8220;NSR&#8221;) values between the two
dates.&#160;&#160;Aside from normal mine depletion, the decrease in mineral 
resources can be attributed to a combination of factors, some of which resulted 
in some pre-existing resource blocks being dropped out of the 
model.&#160;&#160;For example, 1) change in metal prices and less silver 
equivalent contribution from base metals, 2) increased costs and cut-off NSR, 3)
increase in the mining dilution provision in the NSR calculation from 50 to 
100%, 4) better reconciliation guiding metal capping, and 5) a demonstrated 
insufficient continuity of mineralization, which resulted in a portion of 
Inferred Mineral Resources from this area being removed.&#160;&#160;This overall
decrease has been partially countered by some excellent exploration successes on
the El Rosario, San Pablo, Oxi, Oxidada, and Higueras veins.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">San Ignacio Project</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The San Ignacio Project covers approximately four kilometres of
strike length on the La Luz vein system, which is parallel to, and five 
kilometres west of, the principal Veta Madre structure that hosts Great 
Panther's Guanajuato Mine Complex.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A new mine plan is being compiled for San Ignacio incorporating
the latest geological resource model based on the known veins, grade ranges and 
elevation for commencement of mining.&#160;&#160;The Company has acquired 
surface rights allowing sufficient space for the development of a ramp and waste
dumps and for auxiliary infrastructure.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">An infill and extension drilling campaign of approximately 
2,300 metres is anticipated to begin in September to better define the 
resource.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the second quarter, the Company received approval of the
Land Use permit and submitted a revised Environmental Impact Assessment which is
expected to be approved by the end of the third quarter.&#160;&#160;Mine and 
earthwork contractors will be selected along with the installation of a water 
supply for the mine, which will be completed by the end of the third 
quarter.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s latest mineral resource estimate for San 
Ignacio was released in May 2012 (refer to the corresponding technical reports 
dated March 31, 2012 filed on SEDAR on June 26, 2012).&#160;&#160;The mineral 
resource estimate is valid as of March 31, 2012:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">El Horcon Project</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company completed the purchase of a 100% interest in the El
Horcon Silver-Gold Project in Jalisco State, Mexico for total cash consideration
of US$1.6 million on September 5, 2012.&#160;&#160;El Horcon covers 7,908 
hectares in 17 contiguous mining concessions, and is a past producing mine 
located 60 kilometres northwest of the Company&#8217;s Guanajuato Mine 
Complex.&#160;&#160;The proximity to Guanajuato allows for the potential for any
ore which is produced to be trucked to Guanajuato and processed at the Cata 
plant.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The permit to drill at El Horcon was received from the Ministry
of Environment and Natural Resources, SEMARNAT ("Secretar&#237;a de Medio 
Ambiente y Recursos Naturales") on April 9, 2013 and a Phase 1 surface drill 
program was completed which included 2,156 metres in 24 holes. The drilling was
completed along a 650-metre length of the Diamantillo vein and intersected 
several parallel veins: Natividad, San Guillermo and the Diamantillo footwall. 
It was demonstrated that the veins follow distinct structures and are 
continuous.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Assay results have been received and are being compiled and 
interpreted.&#160;&#160;A wireframe and 3D model are being constructed such that
the continuity of grade and vein widths can be determined. An internal resource 
estimate and preliminary economic assessment will be prepared before the end of 
the year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of the date of this MD&amp;A, the Company had not fully 
secured mineral property titles for approximately 5,000<font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>of its 7,908 hectares related to the El 
Horcon Project.&#160;&#160;Certain of the Company&#8217;s title claims have been
cancelled due to what the Company believes is an administrative error on the 
part of the government agency which manages mineral claims in 
Mexico.&#160;&#160;The Company is in the process of attempting to reinstate the 
claims.&#160;&#160;Neither the status of the claims or the process to reinstate 
the claims has affected the Company&#8217;s drilling program as the current 
program does not involve the claims in question.&#160;&#160;The Company expects 
to be successful in reinstating the claims and therefore has not recorded any 
provision against the carrying value of the El Horcon Project.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Santa Rosa Project</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A drill program of five drill holes totaling 1,653 metres was 
completed in 2012. There is no exploration program planned for 
2013.&#160;&#160;A reassessment of the property and regional geology, involving 
geological mapping and sampling will be undertaken in order to better understand
the structural controls on mineralization before planning another drill 
program.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Refer to the &#8220;Results of Operations&#8221; section for a 
complete discussion of the financial results for the second quarter of 
2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">QUARTERLY TRENDS AND MARKET 
DATA</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The climate in Mexico allows mining and exploration activities 
to be conducted throughout the year.&#160;&#160;Therefore, revenue and cost of 
sales generally do not exhibit variations due to seasonality.&#160;&#160;The 
exceptions are periods of excessive drought which may limit mineral 
processing.&#160;&#160;The dry season in Mexico generally extends from October 
through April.&#160;&#160;Revenue will vary based on the quantity of metal 
produced, metal prices and terms of sales agreements.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There can also be significant variances in the Company&#8217;s 
reported net income (loss) from quarter to quarter arising from factors that are
often difficult to anticipate in advance or to predict from past 
results.&#160;&#160;For example, fluctuations in foreign currency, specifically 
the Mexican peso and US dollar against the Canadian dollar may result in 
considerable variances in foreign exchange gains and losses due primarily to a 
significant intercompany loan which is re-valued for each period 
end.&#160;&#160;Fluctuations in the price of silver and gold, and to a lesser 
extent, lead and zinc, can also have a significant impact on the Company&#8217;s
net income (loss).&#160;&#160;In addition, the periodic grant of incentive stock
options, which results in the recording of amounts for share-based payments can 
be quite large in any given quarter.</font><br>
</div>
<div><br>
<hr>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0ERNEK">&#160;</a><a name="ref.ID0EG2HK">&#160;</a></div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> &#8220;Earnings from mining operations&#8221; are defined as 
gross profit.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EXKAM">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font></font>&#160;&#8220;Adjusted EBITDA&#8221; is 
a non-IFRS measure in which standard EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, 
depreciation and amortization) is adjusted for share-based payments expense, 
foreign exchange gains or losses, and non-recurring items.&#160;&#160;The 
Company has updated its definition of adjusted EBITDA and has restated 2011 
comparative figures presented above and elsewhere in this MD&amp;A to reflect 
the exclusion of interest income. The Company does not consider these changes to
be material. Refer to the &#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221; section for the 
definition and a reconciliation of standardized and adjusted EBITDA to the 
financial statements.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>

<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>

new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">26</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; 
TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">%</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2013, the Company earned 
revenues of $11.2 million, compared to $14.4 million for the same period in 
2012, a decrease of 23%.&#160;&#160;The decrease was the result of a 23% 
decrease in average realized silver prices (US$21.58 compared to US$28.06) and a
negative revaluation adjustment of approximately $1.3 million for lower silver 
prices on concentrate shipments prior to the second quarter which were still 
subject to final settlement.&#160;&#160;These factors offset an 11% increase in 
metal sales which totalled 662,825 silver equivalent ounces for the quarter, 
compared to 598,135 silver equivalent ounces for the same period in 
2012.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Revenue for the second quarter of 2013 decreased by $1.5 
million, or 12% when compared to the prior quarter.&#160;&#160;The decrease was 
the result of a 27% decrease in average realized silver prices (US$21.58 in the 
second quarter of 2013 compared to US$29.71 in the prior quarter) which offset a
31% increase in silver equivalent ounces sold when compared to 506,637 silver 
equivalent ounces sold in the first quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;The increase in 
silver equivalent ounces sold is mainly due to increased production as a result 
of higher silver and gold grades.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For 2013, the Company has contracts in place for the sale of 
all its planned concentrate production.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Revenue related to contained metals in concentrate for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013 and 2012 is as follows:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On a segment basis, for the three months ended June 30, 2013, 
Guanajuato and Topia revenues both decreased by 23% compared to the same period 
in 2012 primarily due to the decline in metal prices. In addition, the 
significant negative revaluation adjustment for Guanajuato concentrate sales 
also contributed to the decline in revenues from the mine.&#160;&#160;Gold by-
product revenues remained static despite a 30% increase in gold ounces sold 
which further demonstrates the negative impact of the decline in metal 
prices.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Sales quantities by metal for the three months ended June 30, 
2013 and 2012 were as follows:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">598,135</font></div>
