</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cost of sales excluding amortization and depletion and share-
based payments was $11.4 million for the three months ended June 30, 2013, 
compared to $8.3 million in the same period of 2012. The increase in cost of 
sales, excluding amortization and depletion and share-based payments, is mainly 
the result of higher unit production costs due to lower grades of metals in the 
ore mined at Guanajuato and Topia.&#160;&#160;However, this is also a factor of 
increased metal sales.&#160;&#160;Compared to the first quarter of 2013, cost of
sales, excluding amortization and depletion and share-based payments, increased 
by 20% to $11.4 million from $9.5 million.&#160;&#160;The increase over the 
first quarter of 2013 is wholly attributable to an increase in metal sales as 
unit production costs and unit cost of sales actually decreased over the first
quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Amortization and depletion of mineral properties, plant and 
equipment relating to cost of sales for the three months ended June 30, 2013 was
$3.5 million, compared to $2.3 million in the same period in 
2012.&#160;&#160;The increase in amortization expense for the quarter ended June
30, 2013 is the result of increased silver equivalent ounces sold over the prior
year and the significant investment in mine development and capital equipment 
made in 2012.&#160;&#160;Amortization and depletion of mineral properties, plant
and equipment relating to cost of sales for the second quarter of 2013 of $3.5 
million compares to $2.7 million in the first quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;This 
is mainly due to the increase in silver equivalent ounces sold of 662,825 
compared to 506,637 in the first quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Share-based payments expense relating to cost of sales for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013 were $0.2 million, compared to $19,000 for the 
same period in 2012 and $0.1 million for the first quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the three months ended June 30, 2013, the Company had a 
gross loss of $3.8 million compared to a gross profit of $3.8 million for the 
same period in 2012.&#160;&#160;The decrease in gross profit is attributable to 
lower average realized silver prices and higher unit production costs due 
primarily to lower metal grades.&#160;&#160;In addition, higher amortization and
depletion charges were recognized as a result of increased investment in mineral
properties, plant and equipment in 2012.&#160;&#160;For the three months ended 
June 30, 2013, the Company had a gross loss percentage of 34% compared to a 
gross profit percentage of 26% for the same period in 2012.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Compared to the first quarter of 2013, gross profit decreased 
by $4.1 million, mainly as a result of lower realized metal 
prices.&#160;&#160;Gross loss percentage was 34% in the second quarter of 2013 
compared to a 3% gross profit percentage in the previous 
quarter.&#160;&#160;Compared to the first quarter of 2013, the Company saw an 
improvement in unit cost.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">General and administrative expenses were $2.5 million for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013, compared to $2.1 million for the comparable 
quarter of 2012.&#160;&#160;The increase was largely attributable to severance 
charges which offset general and administrative expense reductions.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0E32DM">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver 
equivalent ounces for 2013 were established using prices US$28 per oz, US$1,680 
per oz, US$0.85 per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for silver, gold, lead and zinc, 
respectively, and applied to the metal content of the concentrates 
sold.&#160;&#160;For consistency, these prices will be used for the balance of 
2013.</font></font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">18</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exploration and evaluation expenses of $1.0 million for the 
three months ended June 30, 2013 were 123% higher than the second quarter of 
2012 and 49% higher than the first quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;The increase in 
both cases was due to the surface drill program at El 
Horcon.&#160;&#160;Exploration and evaluation expenditures are expected to 
decrease in the third and fourth quarters as a result of the completion of the 
El Horcon drill program and the curtailment of exploration activities outside of
the Company&#8217;s operating mines and its San Ignacio project. (Refer to the 
&#8220;Resource and Exploration Update&#8221; section for further
details.)</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Finance and other income was $50,000 for the three months ended
June 30, 2013 compared to a $0.7 million expense for the second quarter of 
2012.&#160;&#160;The reduction in the loss from the second quarter of 2012 
primarily attributable to a $0.6 million decrease in foreign exchange losses 
resulting from the strengthening of the Mexican peso and US dollar compared to 
the Canadian dollar.&#160;&#160;Finance and other income of $50,000 for the 
three month period ending June 30, 2013 compares to finance and other income of 
$4.4 million for the first quarter ending March 31, 2013.&#160;&#160;The 
decrease is primarily a result of a foreign exchange loss of $0.1 million in the
second quarter of 2013, compared to a foreign exchange gain of $4.3 million in 
the first quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Foreign exchange gains and losses arise from the translation of
foreign denominated transactions and balances relative to the functional 
currency of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries and the Company&#8217;s reporting 
currency.&#160;&#160;The Company has significant Canadian and US dollar loans 
receivable from one of its Mexican subsidiaries and fluctuations in the Mexican 
Peso create significant unrealized foreign exchange gains and losses on the 
loans owing to the Canadian parent.&#160;&#160;These unrealized gains and losses
are recognized in the consolidated net income of the Company.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company recorded an income tax recovery of $2.1 million for
the three months ended June 30, 2013 compared to an expense of $0.1 million for 
the same period in 2012.&#160;&#160;The recovery is mainly attributable to pre-
tax losses sustained in the Mexican operating entity during the 
period.&#160;&#160;The Company has net operating tax losses in Canada and has 
not recognized the benefit of any of these losses in the financial statements of
the Company.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Net loss for the three months ended June 30, 2013 was $5.1 
million, compared to net income of $0.4 million for the same period in 
2012.&#160;&#160;The decrease in net income is primarily attributable to a 
decrease in gross profit of $7.6 million, and an increase in exploration and 
evaluation expenses. The factors which contributed to the net loss for the 
second quarter of 2013 were partially offset by a decrease in foreign exchange 
loss and the income tax recovery of $2.1 million recognized in the second 
quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Adjusted EBITDA<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> was negative $3.3 million for the three months ended June 30,
2013 compared to adjusted EBITDA of $3.7 million for the comparable period in 
2012 and $0.5 million for the three months ended March 31, 2013.&#160;&#160;The 
decrease in adjusted EBITDA for the three months ended June 30, 2013 compared to
the three months ended June 30, 2012 and to the three months ended March 31, 
2013 is primarily attributable to the lower gross profit.&#160;&#160;Higher 
exploration and evaluation expenditures also contributed to the decrease in 
Adjusted EBITDA.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0E32DM">&#160;</a><a name="ref.ID0EIEEM">&#160;</a></div>
<div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: text-top">1</font>&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">Adjusted EBITDA is a non-IFRS measure.&#160;&#160;Please refer to the 
&#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221; section for the reconciliation of reported 
financial results to Non-IFRS measures.</font></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>

</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2013, the Company earned 
revenues of $23.8 million, compared to $28.1 million for the same period in 
2012, a decrease of 15%.&#160;&#160;The decrease was the result of a 13% 
decrease in average realized silver prices (US$25.27 compared to US$29.01) and a
negative revaluation adjustment of approximately $0.4 million<font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>for lower silver prices 
on shipments prior to the 2012 year end which were still subject to final 
settlement.&#160;&#160;These factors offset a 9% increase in metal 
sales.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2013, the Company recognized 
revenue on shipments representing 1,169,462<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font>silver equivalent ounces compared to 1,073,181 silver 
equivalent ounces for the same period in 2012. The increase was primarily due to
increased production.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Revenue related to contained metals in concentrate for the six 
months ended June 30, 2013 and 2012 is as follows:</font></div>

</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">20</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div><br>
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On 
a segment basis, for the six months ended June 30, 2013 Guanajuato revenues 
decreased by 21% and Topia revenues remained static when compared to the same 
period in 2012. The decrease at Guanajuato is due to the negative revaluation 
adjustment mentioned above, as well as a 13% decrease in average realized silver
prices, and a 10% decrease in average realized gold prices, which offset a 5% 
increase in silver equivalent ounces sold.&#160;&#160;The revenue at Topia 
remained static as a 19% increase in silver equivalent ounces sold offset the 
decrease in average realized metal prices.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Sales quantities by metal for the six months ended June 30, 
2013 and 2012 were as follows:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>

double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1,169,462</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px 
double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">757,613</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px 
double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">315,568</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px 
double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1,073,181</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new
roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160; </font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cost of sales excluding amortization and depletion and share-
based payments was $20.9 million for the six months ended June 30, 2013, 
compared to $14.2 million in the same period of 2012 mainly as a result of 
higher unit production costs due to lower average silver grades at Guanajuato, 
particularly in the first quarter of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Consolidated cash cost per silver ounce was US$18.35 for the 
six months ended June 30, 2013, a 77% increase compared to US$10.37 for the six 
months ended June 30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The increase is primarily attributable to
lower grades at Guanajuato and to lower by-product credits as a result of lower 
gold prices.&#160;&#160;Refer to the &#8220;Mine Operating Results&#8221; 
section of this MD&amp;A for a more detailed discussion of cash cost per silver 
ounce by mine.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Amortization and depletion of mineral properties, plant and 
equipment relating to cost of sales for the six months ended June 30, 2013 was 
$6.2 million, compared to $3.8 million in the same period in 
2012.&#160;&#160;The increase in amortization expense is the result of increased
silver equivalent ounces sold during the period, and the significant investment 
in mine development and capital equipment made in 2012.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Share-based payments relating to cost of sales for the six 
months ended June 30, 2013 were $0.2 million, compared to $30,000 for the same 
period in 2012.&#160;&#160;The increase is related to share options granted in 
the first and second quarters of 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2013, the Company reported a 
gross loss of $3.5 million compared to gross profit of $10.1 million for the 
same period in 2012 mainly due to lower average realized silver prices and 
higher unit production costs as a result of decreased grades and higher site 
costs.&#160;&#160;In addition, higher amortization and depletion charges were 
recognized as discussed above.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">General and administrative expenses were $4.5 million for the 
six months ended June 30, 2013, compared to $5.2 million for the same period in 
2012. The decrease is primarily due to a one-time payment of $0.7 million made
in the first quarter of the prior year in connection with the retirement of an 
executive and director of the Company.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exploration and evaluation expenses of $1.6 million for the six
months ended June 30, 2013 was 60% higher than the same period in 2012 of $1.0 
million due to the drilling program undertaken at the Company&#8217;s El Horcon 
project in the second quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;Exploration and evaluation 
expenditures are expected to decrease in the third and fourth quarters as a 
result of the completion of the El Horcon drill program and the curtailment of 
exploration activities outside of the Company&#8217;s operating mines and its 
San Ignacio project. (Refer to the &#8220;Resource and Exploration Update&#8221;
section for further details.)</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver equivalent ounces 
for 2013 were established using prices US$28 per oz, US$1,680 per oz, US$0.85 
per lb, and US$0.85 per lb for silver, gold, lead and zinc, respectively, and 
applied to the metal content of the concentrates sold.&#160;&#160;For 
consistency, these prices will be used for the balance of 
2013.</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">21</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Finance and other income was $4.4 million for the six months 
ended June 30, 2013 compared to $3.2 million in the same period of 
2012.&#160;&#160;The increase is mainly due to a $1.3 million increase in 
foreign exchange gains over the same period in the prior year which resulted 
from the strengthening of the Mexican peso and US dollar compared to the 
Canadian dollar during the period.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Foreign exchange gains and losses arise from the translation of
foreign denominated transactions and balances relative to the functional 
currency of the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries and the Company&#8217;s reporting 
currency.&#160;&#160;The Company has significant Canadian and US dollar loans 
receivable from one of its Mexican subsidiaries and fluctuations in the Mexican 
Peso create significant unrealized foreign exchange gains and losses on the 
loans owing to the Canadian parent.&#160;&#160;These unrealized gains and losses
are recognized in the consolidated net income of the Company.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company recorded an income tax recovery of $1.4 million for
the six months ended June 30, 2013 compared to an expense of $2.1 million for 
the same period in 2012.&#160;&#160;The recovery is mainly attributable to pre-
tax losses sustained in the Mexican operating entity during the 
period.&#160;&#160;The Company has net operating tax losses in Canada and has 
not recognized the benefit of any of these losses in the financial statements of
the Company.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Net loss for the six months ended June 30, 2013 was $3.8 
million, compared to net income of $5.0 million for the same period in 
2012.&#160;&#160;The decrease in net income is primarily attributable to a 
decrease in gross profit of $13.6 million and an increase in exploration and 
evaluation expenditures.&#160;The factors contributing to the net loss in six 
months ended June 30, 2013 were partially offset by an increase in foreign 
exchange gains of $1.3 million and the income tax recovery of $1.4 million for 
the period.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Adjusted EBITDA<font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">1</font> was negative $2.8 million for the six months ended June 30, 
2013 compared to adjusted EBITDA of positive $8.1 million for the comparable 
period in 2012 which is mainly attributable decrease in gross profit and 
increase in exploration and evaluation expenditures discussed 
above.&#160;&#160;These factors were partially offset by lower general and 
administrative expenditures.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">NON-IFRS MEASURES</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Throughout this MD&amp;A references are made to cash cost per 
silver ounce, EBITDA, and adjusted EBITDA, each as defined in this 
section.&#160;&#160;These are not recognized measures under IFRS, but are 
provided by the Company as supplemental measures of performance and to provide a
basis for comparison to similar measures commonly reported in the 
industry.&#160;&#160;As there are no standardized methods of calculating these 
measures, the Company&#8217;s methods may differ from those used by others and, 
accordingly, the Company&#8217;s use of these measures may not be directly 
comparable to similarly titled measures used by others.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Cash Cost per Silver Ounce</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The non-IFRS measure of cash cost per silver ounce is used by 
the Company to manage and evaluate operating performance at each of the 
Company&#8217;s mines and is widely reported in the silver mining industry as a 
benchmark for performance, but does not have a standardized 
meaning.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Management of the Company believes that the Company&#8217;s 
ability to control the cash cost per silver ounce is one of its key performance 
drivers impacting both the Company&#8217;s financial condition and results of 
operations.&#160;&#160;Having a low silver production cost base allows the 
Company to remain profitable even during times of declining commodity prices and
provides more flexibility in responding to changing market 
conditions.&#160;&#160;In addition, a profitable operation results in the 
generation of positive cash flows, which then improves the Company&#8217;s 
financial condition.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">To facilitate a better understanding of this measure as 
calculated by the Company, a detailed reconciliation between the cash cost per 
silver ounce and the Company&#8217;s cost of sales as reported in the 
Company&#8217;s Condensed Interim Consolidated Statements of Profit or Loss is 
provided.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EVOGM">&#160;</a><a name="ref.ID0EAXGM">&#160;</a></div>
<div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-
ALIGN: text-top">1</font>&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">Adjusted EBITDA is a non-IFRS measure.&#160;&#160;Please refer to the 
&#8220;Non-IFRS Measures&#8221; section for the reconciliation of reported 
financial results to Non-IFRS measures.</font></font></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double;

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">
<hr>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EVOGM">&#160;</a><a name="ref.ID0EAXGM">&#160;</a><a 
name="ref.ID0ETZHM"><!--EFPlaceholder--></a></div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">1</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gross by-product 
revenue is defined as revenue from the by-products of silver, specifically gold 
at Guanajuato and gold, lead and zinc at Topia, net of the respective smelting 
and refining charges.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EVRIM">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-top">2</font></font>&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Cash cost per silver ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS 
measure and is used by the Company to manage and evaluate operating performance 
at each of the Company&#8217;s mines and is widely reported in the silver mining
industry as a benchmark for performance, but does not have a standardized 
meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the discussion in this section.</font></font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0EXUJM">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">3</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Gross by-product 
revenue is defined as revenue from the by-products of silver, specifically gold 
at Guanajuato and gold, lead and zinc at Topia, net of the respective smelting 
and refining charges.</font></div>
</div>
<div><a name="ref.ID0ETMKM">&#160; </a>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: -9pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: text-
top">4</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Cash cost per
silver ounce&#8221; is a non-IFRS measure and is used by the Company to manage 
and evaluate operating performance at each of the Company&#8217;s mines and is 
widely reported in the silver mining industry as a benchmark for performance, 
but does not have a standardized meaning.&#160;&#160;Refer to the discussion in 
this section.</font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">23</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">EBITDA is a non-IFRS measure that provides an indication of the
Company&#8217;s continuing capacity to generate income from operations before 
taking into account management&#8217;s financing decisions and costs of 
amortizing capital assets.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, EBITDA comprises revenue less
operating expenses before interest expense, interest income, capital asset 
amortization and impairment charges, and income taxes.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Adjusted EBITDA is a non-IFRS measure in which standard EBITDA 
(earnings before interest expense, interest income, taxes, and depreciation and 
amortization) is adjusted for share-based payments expense, foreign exchange 
gains or losses, and non-recurring items.&#160;&#160;Foreign exchange gains or 
losses may consist of both realized and unrealized losses.&#160;&#160;Under 
IFRS, entities must reflect in compensation expense the cost of share-based 
payments.&#160;&#160;In the Company&#8217;s circumstances, share-based payments 
involve a significant accrual of amounts that will not be settled in cash but 
are settled by the issuance of shares in exchange.&#160;&#160;The Company 
discloses adjusted EBITDA to aid in understanding the results of the Company and
is meant to provide further information about the Company&#8217;s financial 
results to investors.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table provides a reconciliation of EBITDA and 
adjusted EBITDA to the 2013 and 2012 condensed interim consolidated financial 
statements:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div align="left">
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; BORDER-
TOP: black 1.5pt solid">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY:
times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(in 000s of CAD)</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; 
PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px; BORDER-TOP: black 1.5pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: 
inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: 
bold">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left;

new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>

BORDER-TOP: black 1.5pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times 
new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">2013 Q2</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN:

<td align="right" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid;

bold">&#160;</font></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: left;

<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: right;

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></td>

</tr><tr bgcolor="white">

<td valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-

<td valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-
ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-
SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">8,132</font></td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double;

FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2013, the Company had net working capital of $35.1 
million and cash and cash equivalents of $21.3 million compared to net working 
capital of $44.5 million and cash and cash equivalents of $20.7 million at 
December 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;Cash and cash equivalents increased by $0.6 
million from the end of 2012 primarily due to cash provided by operating 
activities of $2.7 million and foreign currency gains on translation of cash 
balances of $0.6 million, which were mostly offset by cash used in investing 
activities of $2.7 million.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Operating Activities</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2013, cash flow from 
operating activities was $2.7 million which was unchanged compared to cash flows
provided by operating activities of $2.7 million for the six months ended June 
30, 2012.&#160;&#160;For the three months ended June 30, 2013, cash flows from 
operating activities were negative $0.8 million which compared to negative $3.7 
million in the comparable period of 2012.&#160;&#160;The improvement was the 
result of positive non-cash working capital contributions compared with negative
changes between the two periods.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; 
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Investing Activities</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For the six months ended June 30, 2013, the Company had net 
cash outflows from investing activities of $2.7 million compared to net cash 
outflows of $14.0 million in the comparative period.&#160;&#160;The reduction is
the result of a reduction in capital expenditures and the redemption of $5.1 
million of short-term investments in the second quarter of 2013.&#160;&#160;For 
the three months ended June 30, 2013, the Company had net cash inflows from 
investing activities of $1.2 million compared to net cash outflows of $7.8 
million for the same reasons discussed above.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Financing Activities</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows provided by financing activities were $0.1 million 
for the six months ended June 30, 2013 compared to cash flows provided by 
financing activities of $0.2 million for the six months ended June 30, 
2012.&#160;&#160;During the second quarter of 2013, the Company received 
proceeds from the exercise of options in the amount of $0.1 million, compared to
$nil from the exercise of options in the comparable period of 2012.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Trends in Liquidity and Capital 
Resources</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At the start of 2013, based on prevailing silver and gold 
prices at that time, the Company anticipated that cash flow generated from 
mining activities along with working capital would be sufficient to fund the 
Company&#8217;s operations without requiring any additional capital to meet its 
planned growth and to fund development activities during the remainder of the 
year.&#160;&#160;Recently, silver and gold prices have seen significant 
declines.&#160;&#160;If these recent metal price declines are sustained, the 
Company&#8217;s ability to generate operating cash flow to fund development and 
investing activities will be challenged.&#160;&#160;The Company is working on 
several initiatives to reduce operating costs and improve the profitability of 
its operations in the current metal price environment. In addition, the Company 
has significantly reduced spending on exploration activities and taken steps to 
reduce general and administrative expenditures.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company had $21.3 million in cash and short-term 
investments and net working capital of $35.1 million at June 30, 
2013.&#160;&#160;The Company has assessed the impact of lower silver and gold 
prices on future operating cash flow, and Management believes it has sufficient 
cash and working capital to fund its operating and capital needs for the year 
while it undertakes initiatives to reduce costs, improve grades, and improve 
profitability.&#160;&#160;These measures are expected to offset the cash flow 
impact of the decline in metal prices. However, the Company still expects that 
cash used in investing activities will exceed cash flows from operations for the
year, and that this will result in a reduction of the Company&#8217;s liquidity 
by the end of the year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Although the Company expects a reduction in its working capital
position by the end of the year, the Company expects to have sufficient levels 
of cash and working capital at the end of the year to continue its operating 
plans.&#160;&#160;As such, the Company has no current financing plans and 
believes that its capital resources are sufficient.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In March 2013, the Company provided guidance that it planned to
spend $15 to $20 million in capital expenditures in 2013 (including mine 
development and capitalized exploration and evaluation expenditures) based on 
achieving overall operating cash-flow targets.&#160;&#160;The Company has 
reviewed its capital expenditure plans in light of the recent declines in metal 
prices and has reduced its capital expenditure plans to $12 to $14 million for 
the year.&#160;&#160;These current capital expenditure plans include development
of the San Ignacio Project with the view to commencing production from this area
in 2014, continued mine development and diamond drilling at both Guanajuato and 
Topia, rehabilitation of the Rayas Shaft at Guanajuato, and the acquisition of 
necessary mining and plant equipment.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">25</font></div>

</div>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2013 the Company had the following 
commitments:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div align="left">

</td>

</td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN:

</td>
<td nowrap valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; TEXT-ALIGN:

<td align="right" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double; 
PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px; BORDER-TOP: black 1.5pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY:

<td valign="middle" width="22%">

</td>
<td valign="middle" width="22%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Carrying value</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="middle" width="26%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Currency</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">(1)</font> Classified as short-term investments in the Company&#8217;s
condensed interim consolidated statement of financial position.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: 
text-top">(2)</font> Trade receivables of $6,858 are measured at fair value and 
other receivables of $5,026 are measured at carrying value.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The carrying values of cash and cash equivalents, marketable 
securities, trade and other receivables, and trade and other payables 
approximate their fair values due to the short-term nature of the 
items.&#160;&#160;The fair values of marketable securities are based on current 
bid prices at June 30, 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash and cash equivalents as at June 30, 2013, the settlement 
of trade and other receivables together with future cash flows from operations 
are sufficient to support the Company's future commitments and operational 
needs, including the settlement of trade and other payables.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the reporting period, the Company did not incur any 
material gains or losses in respect of its financial instruments.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company is exposed in varying degrees to a number of risks 
arising from financial instruments. Management&#8217;s close involvement in the 
operations allows for the identification of risks and variances from 
expectations.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s main objectives for managing risks 
are to ensure liquidity, the fulfillment of obligations, the continuation of the
Company&#8217;s mining operations and exploration programs, and to limit 
exposure to credit and market risks.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The risks associated with the financial instruments used by the
Company and the way in which such exposures are managed are as 
follows:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Concentration risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Concentration risk exists in cash and cash equivalents and 
short-term investments because significant balances are maintained with four 
financial institutions.&#160;&#160;To mitigate the risk, the Company diversifies
its cash and cash equivalents and short-term investments by holding guaranteed 
investment certificates and similar securities with a number of different 
financial institutions.&#160;&#160;The primary investment products include, but 
are not limited to, high interest savings accounts and guaranteed investment 
certificates.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">26</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Concentration risk also exists in trade accounts receivable 
because the Company&#8217;s revenues are currently substantially derived from 
sales to three customers.&#160;&#160;To mitigate the risk, the Company continues
to seek other viable customers for the sale of its metal 
concentrates.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Credit risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Credit risk primarily arises from the Company&#8217;s cash and 
cash equivalents, short-term investments, and trade and other 
receivables.&#160;&#160;The risk exposure is limited to their carrying amounts 
at the statement of financial position date.&#160;&#160;The risk is mitigated by
holding cash and cash equivalents with highly rated Canadian and Mexican 
financial institutions.&#160;&#160;The Company does not invest in asset-backed 
deposits or investments and does not expect any credit losses.&#160;&#160;The 
Company periodically assesses the quality of its investments and is satisfied 
with the credit rating of the financial institutions and the investment grade of
its guaranteed investment certificates.&#160;&#160;The Company also assesses the
collectability of its trade receivables by reviewing the creditworthiness of its
customers.&#160;&#160;The Company historically has not had difficulty collecting
receivables from its customers, nor have customers defaulted on any 
payments.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-
FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new 
roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Market risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The significant market risks to which the Company is exposed 
are currency, interest rate, commodity price and exchange risk.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(i)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Currency risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The operating results and financial position of the Company are
reported in Canadian dollars.&#160;&#160;As the Company operates in an 
international environment, some of the Company&#8217;s financial instruments and
transactions are denominated in currencies other than the Canadian dollar, 
namely the US dollar and Mexican peso.&#160;&#160;The results of the 
Company&#8217;s operations are subject to currency transaction and translation 
risks.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(ii)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest rate risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s approach is to invest cash in high interest
savings accounts and guaranteed investment certificates at fixed or floating 
rates of interest in order to maintain liquidity, while achieving a satisfactory
return for shareholders.&#160;&#160;The Company manages risk by monitoring 
changes in interest rates and by maintaining a relatively short duration for its
portfolio of cash equivalent securities.&#160;&#160;Many of these instruments 
can be immediately redeemed and those of a fixed term do not exceed one 
year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(iii)</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Commodity price risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The value of the Company&#8217;s mineral resource properties 
depends on the price of silver, gold, lead and zinc and the outlook for these 
minerals.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Silver and gold prices, as well as lead and zinc prices, have 
historically fluctuated widely and are affected by numerous factors outside of 
the Company&#8217;s control, including, but not limited to, market fluctuations,
government regulations relating to prices, taxes, royalties, allowable 
production, imports, exports, supply, industrial and retail demand, forward 
sales by producers and speculators, levels of worldwide production and short-
term changes in supply and demand because of speculative hedging 
activities.&#160;&#160;The value of trade receivables depends on changes in 
metal prices over the quotation period.&#160;&#160;The Company has not hedged 
silver and gold prices.&#160;&#160;The Company may, from time to time, enter 
into option contracts to mitigate the price risk associated with the sales of 
its lead and zinc by-products for periods not exceeding one year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 
9pt; FONT-SIZE: 9pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 48px">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 24px">
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font 
style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">(iv)</font></div>
</td>
<td width="1173">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Exchange risk</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The fair value of marketable securities is based on quoted 
market prices which the shares of the investments can be exchanged 
for.&#160;&#160;The exchange price of the shares may fluctuate significantly 
depending on various other market factors. To mitigate the risk, the 
Company&#8217;s approach is to maintain minimal investments in marketable 
securities.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div id="PGBRK" style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
8pt">GREAT PANTHER SILVER LIMITED </font></div>
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE:
8pt">THREE AND SIX MONTHS ENDED JUNE 30, 2013 (UNAUDITED) </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; WIDTH: 100%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">27</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>
<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;
FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 8pt">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">OUTLOOK</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">With first half production totaling 1,287,713 silver equivalent
ounces, the Company is on track to meet its guidance of 2.4 to 2.5 million 
silver equivalent ounces for fiscal 2013.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As noted, the Company saw significant improvement in grades and
lower operating costs in its May and June production, particularly at 
Guanajuato.&#160;&#160;However, the benefit of this lower cost production was 
not reflected in the second quarter results and reported cash costs per ounce as
most of this production remained unsold in inventory at the end of the quarter, 
due to shipping lead times.&#160;&#160;The grades and unit cost metrics for May 
and June production are an encouraging sign that the Company&#8217;s grade 
control and cost reduction initiatives are starting to show results and should 
be reflected in future quarters.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A strong emphasis is being placed upon increasing production in
order to maximize operating cash flow.&#160;&#160;The Company still anticipates 
that the start-up of production from San Ignacio in 2014 will significantly 
augment this effort.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">With the continuing focus on cost reductions, grade control, 
and productivity enhancements, we are optimistic that we can continue to improve
unit costs of the operations.&#160;&#160;We caution however, that both 
Guanajuato and Topia have complex geology which makes them prone to significant 
grade variability.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Given the impact of the lower grades seen in most of the first 
half of the year, we are revising our cash cost guidance to $15 - $16 USD per 
silver ounce for the year.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED 
PARTIES</font></div>

0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company has entered into the following transactions with 
related parties:</font></div>
